Dialogue: I thought...I thought you might be able to help me.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Yeah, how?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I had a premonition about the Route 18 pile up. .. I saved some people. And now I think Death is after me.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Nice work. Maybe if you're real lucky, you'll wind up in here with me.  But I doubt you'll survive that long.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: It's not just about me. Someone I saved died last night in a freak accident. What if the others are in danger, too?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Well, if you put them on the list, they're already tits up.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: What list?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Death's list. The precise order you're going to die in.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: The survivors of Flight 180 died in the exact order they were originally meant to die in the plane crash. That was Death's original design.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Exact order? Then I'm next! I was meant to die with my friends, so I'm next!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: But you said someone else died last night. That means Death skipped past you. Someone must have intervened.  Sometime yesterday you must have nearly died, but someone saved you.  Kimberly nods, recalling the events.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Officer Burke pulled me away from the crash that killed my friends.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Congratufuckinglations. That makes you last to go. But don't worry, once the others are dead, it'll come back for you. Always does.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: That still doesn't make sense. You said you die in the same order you were originally meant to. But Evan Shaeffer died last in my premonition, not first.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: It's moving backwards?    Are you sure?  Kimberly reluctantly strains to remember something...  HARD CUT TO:  THE FINAL MOMENTS OF THE PILE UP  Nora's Pacer folds like an accordion, then EXPLODES, followed by Evan screaming in the Trans Am, which gets CREAMED by the semi!  BACK TO:  Kimberly, shaken, does the math.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Yes. In my premonition that Nora woman and her kid died first, then Evan and then...my friends.  Clear is oblivious when Kimberly breaks into silent sobs.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Backwards...that's new.  Clear sees Kimberly crying and softens.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: That's good. Get all your tears out now, you'll need your eyes.  For the signs.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Signs?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: If you have the same power as Alex, you'll be seeing signs soon. When you see anything creepy or ominous, an in-your- face irony kinda thing? Don't ignore it. It usually means the difference between life and death.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: But wait. I don't understand.       Why is this even happening to me?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: That's what Alex used to ask himself right up until...

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: It's obvious you know what you're talking about. You beat it. You have to help us.  Clear suddenly toughens up, an abrupt mood shift.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I didn't beat it; I hid from it. If you were smart you'd put a down payment on a burial plot and say goodbye to the dog, because what little life you have left is over as you know it. Don't make new friends, don't fall in love, and don't ever bother trying to save others. That's the worst killer of them all.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: How can you say that?    What kind of monster are you?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: My family is dead.   My friends are dead. And Alex...  Clear angrily peels a Polaroid off the wall and shows it to Kimberly. While we don't see the photo, Kimberly's horrified face paints a gruesome picture on its own.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: And yes, that's the blade of a fucking ceiling fan in his head.  Clear pounds on the door, apparently done with Kimberly. A GUARD opens the door. Kimberly, devastated, turns to leave, then summons her courage and turns back to Clear.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Know what? I think you're a coward. I think you hide out in here because you're too damn bitter and selfish to care about another  living soul. In my opinion, you're already dead.  Kimberly leaves, giving Clear something to think about.  EXT. KIMBERLY'S HOUSE - DAY  As Kimberly pulls into her driveway, she's surprised to see a STRANGE CAR parked there. Then --  THOMAS, wearing street clothes, peers through the front window of the house. He guiltily backs away as Kimberly gets out.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: I tried calling last night but your father --

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Evan Shaeffer's dead.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: I know. I've gotten calls all morning from everyone who was on the onramp. We're all meeting at my apartment tonight.

Dialogue: Then you believe all this?? That Death is working off a list?

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: I didn't. Until I was dispatched to clean up one of the Flight 180 survivors.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Clean up? I don't...

Speaker: ki mberly
Dialogue: Did you see that??  Thomas, concerned for her, saw nothing.

Dialogue: Pigeons... It's a sign! If Clear's right about the order, then Nora and Tim are going to be attacke d by Pigeons!

Dialogue: I'm not following you --

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: They're next on the list.   We have to find them.

Dialogue: Nice try, kiddo.

Dialogue: Turn around. The cleaning woman said they're at the dentist's. 14th and Main.

Dialogue: We have to tell her she's in danger!

Dialogue: It's happening again.   It's fucking

Dialogue: I am too. But you can use that fear. It'll sharpen your instincts. Keep you alert fro signs. It's the only way you'll be able to sav e the others...and me.

Dialogue: Solus novus anima licet evinco mortis; Only new life can defeat death.  The list of life is forever set by the Divine Plan, the guiding hand that plots the course of the universe, down to its tiniest element s.

Speaker: mortician
Dialogue: The list accounts for every life; from the dawn of man to the great apocalypse. But the introduction of life that was not meant to be, a soul forbidden to roam the earth, that could invalidate Death's list, shatter its very existence.

Dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

Speaker: mortician

Speaker: mortician
Dialogue: But be warned. To disrupt the grand design is to unravel the tapestry of the universe. When you pull all the threads apart, you may find yourself hanging from them.

Dialogue: Yeah, I thought he was supposed to be helpful.

Dialogue: Stop it, don't move him!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Someone call for help!

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: I can't move my fucking leg! Please get me out of here before it explodes!

Speaker: rory
Dialogue: Watch it, dude!

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Help us, we need help over here!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I don't smell any gas. And none's dripping, either.

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: Stop that! I still need this foot, thank you.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Be careful with that, check the gages on the regulator and be mindful of overdoses. Oh, watch for potholes and puddles.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Look, I made him a promise --

Speaker: paramedic
Dialogue: Sorry.   There's no room.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Get that over here!   Move move move!

Speaker: rescue worker
Dialogue: Excuse me, hot soup coming through.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: One more thing.   Watch out for power lines.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: We have to contact Isabella now!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Where's the cell phone Clear gave you?

Speaker: rory
Dialogue: I dunno. I think I gave it to Eugene back at your place.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Damn it. We have to call the Greenwood Police Station and warn Isabella.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: You doing alright in there?

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: My legs are starting to cramp up. And God, why am I so thirsty? Does anyone have any Fiji?

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: Christ, you wanna give me a heads up next time, pal?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: She's at Phelps Memorial. They're prepping her to give birth right now.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Where's that?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: A few miles up the road.   Near the docks.

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: Damn, can't you be quieter with that thing?

Speaker: rescue worker
Dialogue: Sure, I'll just set it to the "quiet" mode.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: We gotta go now.   Isabella's in labor.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: What about that?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: How you doing in there, hero?

Speaker: kat
Dialogue: I guess it could be worse.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: So let's go...Where the hell is Rory?!

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Get back!

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: It wasn't his turn.   And it's not my turn.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Give me the keys to your truck. Now!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Hurry up. There's no time.   She's about to give birth.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: No. If anyone dies from a crash now, it'll be me. But I can't die if Eugene and Isabella are still alive. I'm last on Death's list.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Are you crazy? What makes you think you'd survive?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: What happened when Eugene tried to kill himself out of turn?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Six duds in a row.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: And when it was Rory's turn to die, and Thomas was in the way?

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: That branch fell and saved my life. You're right, Death's maintaining the order.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Let's pray that Isabella's still alive.

Speaker: staff
Dialogue: ...contractions coming quicker now. Take her pressure and CTG. One centimeter dilation. Prep the epidural stat.

Speaker: anesthesiologist
Dialogue: She's going to have to stop moving if I'm going to --

Speaker: anesthesiologist
Dialogue: Goddamn it, keep her still!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Sorry, doctor.

Speaker: anesthesiologist
Dialogue: Perfectly still now...

Speaker: anesthesiologist
Dialogue: Done.  Now could someone please find the open window and fucking close it?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: This makes no sense. Isabella was supposed to crash her van into a lake. Could we have altered her destiny when we had her arrested?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I don't think so. Alex's premonitions happened exactly as he saw them no matter how much we

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Then the only way to survive is to get to the hospital and protect Eugene and Isabella for as long as we can.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: If only Alex and I had done that with the others, Alex might still be...

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Um, Kimberly? This is a neighborhood. You may wanna slow it down.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Don't worry. Nothing can happen to us.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: I wasn't worried about us.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Slow down! We're...

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: What did you see? What am I looking for?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: No, it's not here. This one was different. More like the pile up and the van going into the lake. It wasn't just a sign, I was there.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Another premonition?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Yes. I was in a hospital. There was screaming... A nurse was choking me. I couldn't tell wh at she looked like, but the name tag was right in my face. Kalarjian.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Kalarjian?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I think a nurse named Kalarjian is going to choke Isabella to death!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Quite complaining. I got burnt babies in the Children's Ward braver than you.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Don't bother. You won't be talking for at least a month. Think you can handle that, Jabberjaw?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Don't worry. Everyone learns to love me once they get used to my sense of humor, okay?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Shouldn't we pull over?

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: No time. Keep going. I wouldn't know how to explain any of this anyway.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Oh come on.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: What do you want me to do?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Speed up.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Yeah, fuck 'em.  No offense.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Be alive, Isabella, please be alive.

Speaker: orderly
Dialogue: Need a pen? Sure. If you like, I'll bring crosswords for you, too.

Speaker: anchor man
Dialogue: Good advice, Sue. And stay in school. Up next, Johnny Showers has the weather...

Speaker: orderly
Dialogue: Jeez, it's freezing in here.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: What are you doing? The Henzels are still waiting for you in the Children's Ward --

Speaker: orderly
Dialogue: Right, right, right.     Gregory's big day.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: And Mrs. Dempsey in hydrotherapy can't feel her legs.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Isabella Cruz.    What room's she in?

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I can't give out that info unless you're a relative.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I'm her sister.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: I'll have to see your ID, Ms. Cruz.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Delivery rooms are downstairs. I'll find Eugene and catch up with you.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Hurry, I think she's this way.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: Security?

Speaker: obstetrician
Dialogue: Listen to me, Isabella, I need you to stop pushing.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What's wrong? IS the baby all right?

Speaker: obstetrician
Dialogue: It's a breach. If I can't reverse

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Maybe I should step outside.

Speaker: pa announcement
Dialogue: Code Blue in Delivery Room 6.   Code Blue!

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Just where do you think you're going?

Speaker: obstetrician
Dialogue: Almost there. I see the head...

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: What are you doing in here?    Get the hell out! Right now!

Speaker: obstetrician
Dialogue: Isabella, look down and see your son.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: A guard grabbed me before I could find Eugene.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Don't sweat it.   It's over.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: She had the baby?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: New life defeats death. We've done it. Death has to rewrite the list. We're safe.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Are you okay? You just face planted!

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I know how it feels to be dead.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: What did you see?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I was dead. And came back to life. An EEG machine. Where's Eugene?

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: But it's over. Isabella's baby was the key. You saw her die and everything, right?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I don't...what if I made a mistake?

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Impossible. She was on the onramp.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I'm not sure... I don't think Isabella was ever destined to die in the pile -up.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Then what's the premonition of the lake supposed to mean?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Can you remember anything about it?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: ...the Same hands from the van.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: It's you Kimberly. The premonitions are about you.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: No!   It can't be.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I have to save Eugene!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Eugene?    Are you in there?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Oh no...

Speaker: orderly
Dialogue: Thanks hon, the Henzels are going crazy for this thing.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Nurse Kalarjian...

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Oh my God. That's it. The lake. The EEG machine. Nurse Kalarjian.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: You can't cheat destiny. I know what I have to do to save us. I have to die.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: That's crazy. You can't give up now. We can still fight this thing.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: I have to do this.

Speaker: emt
Dialogue: What the fuck?!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: She's back!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Kimberly?!

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Welcome back. We did it.           For real.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: I know.   I can feel it too.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: My God, this is delicious. I can't believe I used to be a vegan.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: What's wrong with a platonic relationship?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: For God's sake, leave him alone, Dad.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Yeah, don't make me cite you for harassment.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Well, technically when we died, we gave Death what it wanted. And by the time we were revived, it had already moved on to graver pastures.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Food's great too, Mrs. Gibbons. Big props to you and Brian.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Three short glorious weeks away.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Dad, you had the spatula last, right?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Brian looks like he's having fun.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: How's that?
